result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant shall comply with all of the terms of bond, which continues to remain in effect during the period of this agreement.   Prior to the expiration of the agreement, the defendant must complete an educational program focusing on caring for/parenting infants.  Proof of completion must be provided to the Taylor County District Attorney's Office.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement the court granted the state's motion for a deferred entry of judgment of conviction on this charge for a period of two years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement the state will move to dismiss the charge.

supervisions.notes: The fine and costs are to be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Courts at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning November 1, 2022.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taylor W. Bryant

records.addlTxt: *Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with E.A.S. - dob:  9-16-2021.  Defendant shall not have any unsupervised contact with any minors.

9:03 AM Defendant Taylor W. Bryant in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Taylor W. Bryant.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Plea agreement recited into the record. Case No. 22CF41 - Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information to be filed.  No objection to Information being filed later. Case No. 22CF41 -  Plea of no contest to count 1 and Count 2 -  child neglect  - 948.21.  Case No. 22CF61 - Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2 in 22CF41 and Count 2 in 22CF61.  Court makes a finding of guilt in Count 1. The remaining counts is 22CF61 are dismissed and read in.  Statement by Attorney Fuhr.  Statement by Attorney Smith.   Court orders in Count 1 a deferred entry of Judgment for a period of two years with standard conditions and parenting class.  Upon successful completion the charge will be dismissed.  Count 2 - 22CF41 court orders a $318.00 fine and $200.00 DNA surcharge.  Count 2 in 22CF61 - court orders a withheld sentence and placement on probation for one year with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; domestic abuse surcharge; letter of apology to the victim; complete a domestic violence class; no contact with victim; complete his HSED/GED or adult diploma.  Court converts $5,000.00 cash to a $5,000.00 signature; booking; no contact with EAS and no unsupervised contact.  22CF41 - 6 days credit - 22CF61  2 days credit  - Payment plan of $50.00 a month beginning November 1, 2022

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with E.A.S. - dob:  9-16-2021.  Defendant shall not have any unsupervised contact with any minors.

1:34 PM Defendant Taylor W. Bryant in court.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Taylor W. Bryant.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Fuhr is requesting a $5,000.00 cash bond.  Statement by Attorney Smith.  Court orders a $5,000.00 cash bond; with the same conditions as previously ordered.  Scheduled for plea and sentencing September 8, 2022 at 9:00 am was previously scheduled for a status hearing.
Bail/bond hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:30 pm.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Taylor Bryant appeared in person, in custody.  Defendant was in court for a bond hearing for new charges.  Attorney Tlusty requested that the clerk begin bond revocation proceedings in this case.  So ordered by the Court.
Status hearing on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status hearing on August 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.   Bond continued.
